verb.description: Claim that one has (a quality or feeling), especially when this is not the case.
examples: he had professed his love for her
I don't profess to be an expert
he professed himself amazed at the boy's ability

verb.description: Affirm one's faith in or allegiance to (a religion or set of beliefs)

origin: Middle English (as be professed be received into a religious order): from Latin profess- declared publicly, from the verb profiteri, from pro- before + fateri confess.
